Name: Tanged dagger
Description: Hyksos daggers are strengthened lengthwise by a strong angular ridge in the middle. The ridge is usually decorated. A tang and rivets served to secure the dagger in a hilt made of a different material, the upper end forming a knob. Daggers like these come from tombs and were found near the pelvic region of the deceased. The tang of this dagger has broken off, one rivet is preserved.
